channel.title: Probability on Mark Gingrass Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Probability on Mark Gingrass Blog

item.title: Nonograms Permutations
item.description: Nonogram Permutation This started with a friend asking for help figuring out a for loop. She wanted to know how many different ways she can arrange this setup. Nonograms are picture logic puzzles in which cells in a grid must be colored or left blank according to numbers at the side of the grid to reveal a hidden picture. I was playing around with figuring out how many permutations based on number of columns, hints, and hint values.
